data.title: 'Have a project and experience better IntelliSense and code navigation' needs polish
data.body:
Related to #4007
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any .js workspace, get a notification
2. 'Have a project and experience better IntelliSense and code navigation' does not sound specific enough imho. I would mention JavaScript, and we never surface 'InteliSense' in UI, so I would go for 'suggestions'

So something like:
'Configure a JavaScript project and experience better suggestions and code navigation'

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 14 08 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13778660/6720b700-eab7-11e5-8313-32c87bf0d390.png)

data.title: 'Create jsconfig.json file...' should be 'Create jsconfig.json'
data.body:
Related to #4007
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any .js workspace, get a notification
2. Notice the long action title 'Create jsconfig.json file...', I would go with a shorter version 'Create jsconfig.json', 'file' is superflous

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 14 08 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13778660/6720b700-eab7-11e5-8313-32c87bf0d390.png)

data.title: [js] should not remove whitespace after 'function'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: 10.11.3

Formatting JavaScript code causes whitespace remove after 'function' word. This is inappropriate behaviour considering previous versions of IDE. Should be some flag which allow user to set proper formatting for such situation.  

`
Before (0.10.6):
var foo = function () {};

Now: 
var foo = function() {};
`

data.title: [js] syntax highlighting broken after bracket in the same line as 'if' or 'for'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Win 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write some code with an 'if' statement, and a variable compared with an smaller-as '<' operator (without separating space). 
2. Add a code block bracket on the same line.
3. Write more code in the block

Minimal example:
`var j;`
`if(j<2){`
`var i=123;`
`}`

Result in the dark+ standard scheme:

![vscodejshighlightingproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6265026/13776959/50bb949e-eaad-11e5-8fd8-1530d15e7206.png)

btw. what should the color of the `j`be? It is different in the second example.

data.title: Error while Downloading and configuring the .NET Core Debugger
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: ubuntu 14.04-x64

After installing csharp extension, I'm getting message 'installation is successful'. But after that, there is this error,

```
error: File '/home/dhananjay/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-0.3.6/NuGet.config' does not exist.
dotnet exited with error code 1
Error while installing .NET Core Debugger.
```

But C# is present in installed extensions list.

data.title: Closing extension Code instance doesn't make `Run` stop
data.body:
Testing #3906

Linux
1. `yo code`, TypeScript extension, `code` into it
2. Run the `Run` action until the extension Code instance comes up
3. Close the Code instance that comes up

It appears that the instance is still running, in the original Code window.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13772128/c1a3004a-ea92-11e5-8bcc-a457020b8082.gif)

data.title: Debugging doesn't start on a fresh TypeScript extension when running the "Debug: Start" action
data.body:
Testing #3906

Linux
1. `yo code`
2. Choose TypeScript extension
3. Open the extension in Code
4. Run `Debug: Start` or `Run`.

Nothing happens besides the appearance of an `out` folder in the explorer. You need to run the action once more to get the instance of Code running your extension.

data.title: Stopping a program that ran with the Run action doesn't stop it
data.body:
Testing #3906 

Linux
1. <kbd>Ctrl F5</kbd>
2. Press `Stop`

Process is still laying around. If it's a web server (as is in the screencast), you can't launch it twice since the running process keeps an open port.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13771771/7c4482e6-ea90-11e5-81bf-84f452ad9b55.gif)

data.title: Run action seems very alone in command pallete
data.body:
Testing #3906 

The action just seems lost, since the only thing it displays in the command palette is `Run`.

Could we put it under the `Debug` category, so we'd see it when we type `Debug` in the command palette?

data.title: Run action doesn't open up the console
data.body:
Testing #3906

I'd expect it to behave similarly to the Debug action.

2. Syntax highlight thinks it is a variable declaration in the name:

data.title: MoveFile failed; code 183. Cannot create a file when that file already exists
data.body: - VSCode Version: Latest as at this post (can't check since it will not run) - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open VS Code and wait for a update 2. Ask it to update 3. Error pops up. The file is `askpass.sh` 4. Try deleting the file causing the problem (didn't work on my machine) 5. Click ignore (VS Code Insider no longer runs This is from the insider channel. When updating the main version, I got the same message, asked it to ignore. Currently, that instance crashes every few minutes. Not sure if the ignore was the cause. Running from the command line gives the error below `{ errorCode: 'load', moduleId: 'https-proxy-agent', neededBy: [ 'vs/base/node/proxy' ], detail: { [Error: Cannot find module 'https-proxy-agent'] code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND' } }`

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have installed 0.10.10
2. Download update
3. Execute update (from any folder on system (downloads or D drive (Windows is on C))

Error is thrown:

I have Admin access on PC.

data.title: Column selection has unexpected behavior when I type to replace selection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
#4092
- VSCode Version: 10.12 Alpha
- OS Version: Mac

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select multiple lines of HTML with column select so that last character of each line of your selection ends with the a `<`
2. Type a `<` to replace the selection with this character
3. Note that the selection is not merely replaced with `<`, but unexpectedly it leaves in spaces and adds an extra `<` at the end of the selection, changing the last `<` to a `<>`
4. This actually also happens regardless if the `<` is the last character (as long as it's in the selection somewhere), and it also happens if a `>` is in the selection.

This does not happen with unrelated characters to the last character in the selection.
![broken rectangle select](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/13770009/550bae74-ea41-11e5-965b-bb8c844d5d6c.gif)

data.title: [V-test][GO] When trying to install missing tools from the Analyzer (status bar) then it is throwing error like : 'go' is not recognized.
data.body:
VSCode Version: Windows10
OS Version: 0.10.12-alpha

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Install go from this location:https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/bd7675ba-1bf5-4395-8c5a-4fc19dfc0d76

2.Create directory structure and set environment variable for GOPATH, GOBIN. by following instruction provided at : https://golang.org/doc/install?download=go1.6.windows-amd64.msi 
3.Now add a .go file under workspace dir and execute below command to generate a EXE under GOBIN file.
4.Once exe is generated successfully, open the workspace folder in VSCODE.
5.Open go file and install GO extension.
6.Verify extension installed successfully without any error.
7.Verify GOPATH error should not be displayed as environment variables are already been set.
8. Verify status bar and click on install missing tools.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13768629/95a31e1a-ea35-11e5-8d38-3d835b3a4080.png)
9. Verify pop-up message and click on install button.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13768618/64832942-ea35-11e5-9c1e-1961e9a64039.png)
10. Verify output window.
Actual: 
1. Output windows throwing error like 'go' is not recognized as an internal or external command, for all the tools. But when I copied the same command on command prompt and executed it is displaying some different error message like:
**C:\Users\v-pavanp>C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe /s /c "go get -u -v github.com/tpng/gopkgs"
github.com/tpng/gopkgs (download)
go: missing Git command. See https://golang.org/s/gogetcmd
package github.com/tpng/gopkgs: exec: "git": executable file not found in %PATH%**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13768600/43fd4a9a-ea35-11e5-8933-1e7b83bc5b1d.png)

data.title: [V-test][GO] Getting error message like "Error: Type Error: Bad argument" when opening a folder containing GO code.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Windows10
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install go from this location:https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/bd7675ba-1bf5-4395-8c5a-4fc19dfc0d76  
2. Create directory structure and set environment variable for GOPATH, GOBIN. by following instruction provided at : https://golang.org/doc/install?download=go1.6.windows-amd64.msi 
3. Now add a .go file under workspace dir and execute below command to generate a EXE under GOBIN file.
4. Once exe is generated successfully, open the workspace folder in VSCODE.
5. Open go file and install GO extension.
6. Verify extension installed successfully without any error.
7. Verify GOPATH error should not be displayed as environment variables are already been set.

Actual: Getting error message "Error : Type Error: Bad argument".
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13767376/d3d11480-ea26-11e5-9b37-1d0e264ecd00.png)

Expected: There should not be any error message like this.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: MacOS X El Capitan (v10.11.3)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. After having updated my Visual Studio Code app I'm always having this info message on the top and even if I update my .bash_profile file it continues with this message in an endless loop!

data.title: Release updates don't restore working files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: 10.11.13

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Work on a few files to populate the Working Files pane.
2. Don't close/shutdown VSCode whilst you wait for an update.
3. Once an update is available, click 'Update Now'.
4. Code restores the 'Working Files' to the worked files last  time you shutdown Code. 

Expected behaviour: Code should save the session (e.g. Working Files) prior to updating, and restore those Files once it's been updated/restarted due to an update.

data.title: Shortcut command, "deleteWordRight" is deleting left when at end of line.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

Using the default keyboard shortcut for "ctrl+delete", use the shortcut on text when at the end of the line. The entire line will be deleted.

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17713219/13765288/c4a4e37a-eaa7-11e5-9031-810d60f3bd5a.png)
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17713219/13765289/c4a79eb2-eaa7-11e5-86b2-990e37b877df.png)

Expected behaviour is that it will shift the previous line up to the cursor if it is at the end of the line.
